title: Wild cat, wilder rumours: Leopard out of sight, but social media keeps panic alive
content: Fictional narratives about the animal, which was first spotted around Chilukur, are doing rounds at a frenzied pace, confounding the residents around Gandipet and leading to fear-mongering.

title: Indian national gets 14 years in jail for sexually assaulting minor girl in Singapore
content: Sentenced by the Singapore High Court, Ramalingam Selvasekaran, 58, will not be caned, as he is over 50. However, his sentence of 14 years, three months and two weeks includes additional jail time in lieu of 15 strokes of the cane

title: U.P. SDM transferred day after doing sit-ups in front of lawyers to admit filth in tehsil premises
content: Shahjahanpur District Magistrate Dharmendra Pratap Singh told PTI that Rahi, who was posted to Puwaiyan tehsil only on Tuesday, has now been relieved of the post.

title: Sudden braking on Highway is negligence, says Supreme Court
content: A bench comprising Justices Suddhanshu Dhulia and Aravind Kumar observed that a driver's abrupt halt in the middle of a highway, even if triggered by a personal emergency, cannot be justified if it endangers other road users.

title: Same-day darshan for ‘Srivani’ ticket-holders in Tirumala
content: TTD to roll out the pilot initiative from August 1; from November 1, both offline and online ticket-holders will be granted darshan at 4.30 p.m. through the Vaikuntham Queue Complex-1, says official

title: MBBS student in Kashmir posts video of ‘career’s first delivery case’ online, faces flak from J&K medical council
content: A doctor from the Government Medical College, Srinagar, posted a video online as part of his vlogging to “celebrate” the patient’s delivery inside the theatre

title: Vijayawada reinstated Haj embarkation point
content: The announcement follows a formal request by Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu to Union Minister of Minority Affairs Kiren Rijiju

title: High alert sounded along the Krishna amid huge inflows from Pulichintala
content: In Vijayawada, the authorities lifted all the 70 crest gates at the Prakasam Barrage, releasing 71,000 cusecs of water downstream

title: Liquor scam case: SIT takes into custody, questions Varun Purushotham
content: Named Accused No. 40 in the case, Varun, who has been on the run and against whom the court issued NBW, has been taken into custody at the Shamshabad airport as he arrives from Dubai; Accused No. 1 Kessireddy files affidavit in court stating he has no connection with the ₹11 crore cash seized in a farmhouse in Ranga Reddy district

title: Malda migrant worker’s family backs Mamata claim of harassment by Delhi police
content: Sanjur Parveen and other members of the family who hail from Malda in West Bengal held a press conference at the Trinamool Congress party office in Kolkata and alleged torture by Delhi police. The Delhi police said that the video shared by the Chief Minister about migrant worker’s family alleging harassment in the national capital was fabricated.

title: Plus One: admission to vacant seats on July 31
content: Students who had applied for admission in the merit quota but had not got allotment had been given time till 4 p.m. on Wednesday to apply for admission to seats that still remained vacant

title: President Murmu lauds contributions of former West Bengal Chief Minister Dr B.C. Roy
content: The President on Wednesday attended the first convocation ceremony of AIIMS, Kalyani in West Bengal’s Nadia district

title: ‘Over 42,000 fake birth certificates of illegal Bangladeshis cancelled in Maharashtra till now, but many more exist’
content: In a special drive till August 15, the State govt to cancel all ‘fake’ birth certificates to Bangladeshis staying illegally in the State, says minister

title: On SC directive, CBI registers 22 cases to probe alleged builders-banks nexus; conducts searches at 47 locations in NCR
content: Hundreds of homebuyers in the NCR, being cheated by builders/developers and further aggrieved by the coercive action of financial institutions against them, had approached the Supreme Court seeking relief

title: RSS arm seeks clarity on draft guidelines on biosimilars
content: Swadeshi Jagran Manch appreciated the draft guidelines for embracing the “3Rs principle” (replacement, reduction, refinement) as it reflects India’s commitment to ethical scientific practices

title: No expenditure incurred on engaging social media influencers, says Centre
content: Eight influencer marketing agencies were empanelled for the MyGov citizen engagement platform following the due process, Minister of State for Information and Broadcasting L. Murugan said

title: At least two soldiers, two teachers killed in shooting stone, flash floods in Ladakh, J&K
content: An Army spokesperson said two soldiers died when an Army vehicle was hit by a boulder during a convoy movement between Durbuk to Chongtash

title: Odisha evacuates 5,000 people as floods upend lives of 30,000
content: While 5,000 people have been evacuated, the Odisha government has announced that cooked food will be supplied for the next seven days to the affected

title: CRPF constable found dead in Bijapur
content: An investigation was underway to ascertain the exact reason that prompted him to take the extreme step

title: Small-scale fishers seek rollback of unified licence fee
content: They allege that the unified fee, which treats small and big boats alike, has doubled the financial burden of traditional operators

title: Contract for biomining of legacy waste at Brahmapuram extended till September
content: Opposing the extension of the contract, the UDF says the volume of waste at Brahmapuram is exaggerated; cites audit objections and failure of the company to complete biomining within the agreed time

title: World Day Against Trafficking: Telangana pushes for time-bound justice for trafficked children
content: Between April 2024 and April 2025, the JRC network of 250 NGOs in 418 districts rescued 56,242 trafficked children and initiated over 38,000 legal actions across India

title: Promoting A.P. as investment destination remains mainstay of Naidu’s Singapore tour
content: Singapore Minister says his government will continue to support the development of Andhra Pradesh and Amaravati, through technical cooperation

title: 2,900 people rescued as heavy rains create flood-like situation in M.P.; two die as house collapses in Gwalior
content: The Chief Minister has also directed all district administrations and concerned authorities to remain on high alert due to the forecast of heavy rains over the next two days in several districts

title: Apollo launches ‘End-O Check’ for early detection of ovarian cancer
content: End-O Check provides comprehensive risk assessment, clinical diagnostics, and symptom monitoring to support early detection of gynaecologic cancers, particularly in postmenopausal women

title: Remove laws going against leprosy-hit persons: Supreme Court
content: The court said the Centre and States will do great service by removing discriminatory provisions of law. It urged States to call a one-day Assembly session or enact an ordinance

title: $220m worth of deals under scanner: US sanctions 6 Indian firms over Iran oil trade
content: The US has imposed sanctions on six Indian businesses, along with other global entities, for allegedly violating restrictions on Iran by engaging in significant transactions involving Iranian petroleum and petrochemical products. These India-based companies are accused of importing and trading Iranian goods worth millions of dollars.

title: Techie killed over inter-caste love: Kavin's murder sparks outrage; family refuses to accept body
content: The murder investigation of Kavin Selvaganesh, a 27-year-old dalit man, has been transferred to CB-CID due to the main accused's parents being police sub-inspectors. Surjith has been detained under the Goondas Act. Kavin's parents are refusing to claim his body, demanding the arrest of Surjith's parents and action against allegedly complicit police officials.

title: Malegaon blast: 17 years on, court to rule on terror case; ex-BJP MP Pragya Thakur among 7 accused
content: A special NIA court in Mumbai is set to pronounce judgment in the 2008 Malegaon blast case, which killed six and injured over 100. The accused, including Pragya Thakur and Lt Col Prasad Purohit, face charges under UAPA and IPC for their alleged involvement in the terror plot.

title: Chess: Divya dedicates World Cup title to her first trainer, who passed away in 2020
content: Nineteen-year-old Divya Deshmukh was celebrated at Nagpur airport after her Women's World Cup victory in Batumi, where she triumphed over Koneru Humpy. This win secured her the Grandmaster title, a spot in the Candidates tournament, and a $50,000 prize. She credited her first coach Rahul Joshi, who passed away in 2020.

title: Mira Murati on her team rejecting Mark Zuckerberg’s $1 billion offer to join Meta AI
content: Meta's aggressive pursuit of AI talent faced a significant setback as Thinking Machines Lab, led by Mira Murati, reportedly rejected lucrative offers, some reaching a billion dollars, to join Meta's Superintelligence Lab. Murati's team prioritized independence and long-term vision over substantial financial gains, highlighting the allure of shaping AI's future outside a corporate giant.

title: Bumrah out, Kuldeep in! A new-look bowling attack to be fielded in 5th Test
content: India, already trailing 1-2 in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy 2025, aim to draw the series against England in the final Test at The Oval. Wasim Jaffer suggests an XI featuring Kuldeep Yadav amid injuries to key players like Rishabh Pant and Jasprit Bumrah. The lineup emphasises a strong batting order and a three-man spin attack to salvage pride.

title: 'How dare you insult the Boss': Pratham alleges threats from Darshan fans
content: Actor Pratham M filed a police complaint alleging threats from individuals, including Bakery Raghu and Yashashwini, for his comments on actor Darshan, who is implicated in the Renukaswamy murder case. Pratham claims he was threatened with a weapon and verbally abused for speaking against Darshan.

title: 'There are only engineers': Musk corrects 'hiring post' of xAI's Aditya Gupta
content: Elon Musk's xAI is doing away with the title "researcher," opting for "engineer" for all technical roles, a decision prompted by Musk's direct intervention on X. This move aims to eliminate what Musk sees as a two-tiered system, aligning xAI with companies like OpenAI and Anthropic that favor unified technical titles.

title: What do Trump’s 25% tariffs on India mean? What happens if they stay…
content: US President Trump has imposed a 25% tariff on Indian goods amidst ongoing trade deal negotiations. Trump cited high Indian tariffs and its energy and military ties with Russia as reasons. Experts warn of potential GDP growth reduction for India, though some believe the impact will be temporary, pending a trade agreement.

title: Divya is a Chess World Cup winner - but not a World Champion yet: Why?
content: Divya Deshmukh, an Indian chess player, won the FIDE Women’s World Cup in Batumi. She defeated Koneru Humpy in the final through an intense tie-break. This victory also earned her the Grandmaster title. Ju Wenjun of China is still the reigning Women's World Champion. Divya's World Cup win qualifies her for the Candidates Tournament.

title: Technical issues force UK to ground flights: Here’s what caused it
content: A technical failure at the UK's air traffic control centre in Swanwick caused a brief shutdown of London's airspace, leading to flight disruptions across the country. The issue, affecting radar systems, temporarily hindered controllers' ability to accurately track aircraft, raising safety concerns.

title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for July 31- check list
content: Top stock market recommendations: Nuvama Professional Clients Group's Aakash K Hindocha recommends buying Jindal Steel, Ajanta Pharma, and Godrej Agrovet. Hindocha anticipates range-bound trading for Nifty between 24600 and 25010, advising caution below 24600. Bank Nifty's positive trend targets 56800/57100, contingent on holding above 55800.

title: IND vs ENG: Ex-CSK pacer spotted training with Team India ahead of 5th Test - Watch
content: India prepare for the series-deciding fifth Test against England at The Oval on Thursday, trailing 2-1. Injuries to Jasprit Bumrah and Rishabh Pant pose challenges, with Narayan Jagadeesan added as cover. Deepak Chahar’s surprise presence at training has sparked speculation. England, missing Ben Stokes, makes four changes, while India must win to avoid a series defeat.

title: Another blow for Brazil! US slaps 50% tariff to safeguard American interests
content: Donald Trump has escalated tensions with Brazil by imposing 50% tariffs, citing an economic emergency due to Brazil's policies and the prosecution of Jair Bolsonaro. Exemptions exist for key sectors, while the US accuses Brazil's judiciary of coercing social media companies. Lula vows to defend Brazilian sovereignty, as the US also sanctions a Supreme Court Justice.

title: Midtown Manhattan shooting: Gunman bought rifle from his boss in Las Vegas
content: Shane Tamura, 27, fatally shot four individuals at a Manhattan office tower, including an NYPD officer, before taking his own life. The AR-15-style rifle used in the attack was purchased legally by his supervisor at the Horseshoe Las Vegas casino and then sold to Tamura.

title: Commanders' $3.8B stadium advances: Trump calls to revive ‘Redskins’ name
content: The Washington Commanders are planning a new stadium near Washington DC. The project has support from fans and Mayor Muriel Bowser. It includes housing and parks. However, Donald Trump wants the team to change its name back to 'Redskins'. He is linking his support for the stadium to this demand. This creates a debate about the team's identity.

title: After Carlsen, Niemann, Dutch no. 1 Giri rages, bangs his mouse - Watch
content: Tensions soared at the Esports Chess World Cup 2025 as Nihal Sarin of India triumphed over Dutch champion Anish Giri, triggering a fit of rage from Giri, who was seen banging his mouse. This incident follows a similar outburst by Hans Niemann after his defeat by Giri. The rising emotional displays are sparking conversations about the pressure players face.

title: Trump vs Trump: How US president's trade rant undercut his claim on India-Pak truce
content: Donald Trump's recent criticism of India's tariffs contradicts his earlier assertion that he influenced India to halt 'Operation Sindoor' against Pakistan by threatening trade restrictions. This outburst occurred amidst parliamentary debates in India, where PM Modi refuted Trump's claim of mediation, attributing the cessation to the IAF's successful strikes.

title: Gambhir and Gill: Accidental partnership one push away from 'significant' scoreline
content: The Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy series stands at 2-1, favouring England. India, led by Shubman Gill and coached by Gautam Gambhir, seeks an equaliser in London. Despite inexperience, the team has shown resilience. Gill defends Gambhir's actions regarding the pitch, expressing optimism about levelling the series. The team has faced challenges but remains focused on a significant achievement.

title: ‘Saiyaara’ day 13: Film mints Rs 7 cr on 2nd Wednesday
content: Mohit Suri's 'Saiyaara,' starring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, nears ₹275 crore at the Indian box office after nearly three weeks. Despite a slight dip, the film earned ₹7 crore on its thirteenth day, totaling ₹273.50 crore domestically. Globally, 'Saiyaara' has surpassed ₹400 crore, outperforming 'Kabir Singh' and 'Sitaare Zameen Par'.

title: Shannon Sharpe’s net worth: Earnings revealed as ESPN parts ways with ex-NFL star
content: ESPN has severed ties with Shannon Sharpe following the settlement of a $50 million lawsuit alleging rape and sexual assault. Despite his absence since April, this marks a significant shift for the Hall of Fame tight end. Sharpe's estimated $30 million net worth stems from his successful NFL career and popular podcasts like Club Shay Shay and Nightcap.

title: ‘Will know by weekend ... ’: Trump's big update on India deal
content: US President Trump stated that America is in trade talks with India. He sees BRICS as potentially anti-dollar. He mentioned India's willingness to substantially cut tariffs.

title: Shannon Sharpe lawsuit twist: OnlyFans model settles; payout reportedly under $50M
content: NFL legend Shannon Sharpe settled a lawsuit with a 20-year-old OnlyFans model. The model initially sued Sharpe for $50 million, alleging sexual assault. Sources indicate Sharpe paid $23 million to resolve the case. Both parties acknowledge a consensual relationship. The model's lawyer confirmed a mutually agreed resolution. Sharpe has not commented publicly on the settlement. He continues his podcast work.

title: NHL: Nazem Kadri could join Montreal Canadiens; Toronto Maple Leafs move blocked
content: Nazem Kadri might be heading to the Montreal Canadiens as Calgary reportedly refuses trades with Toronto. Friction from Brad Treliving's past dealings with Calgary limits Kadri's options. Montreal, with its young core and skilled system, presents an appealing destination for the veteran center, potentially stabilizing their second line and providing valuable leadership.

title: Linda Hogan’s bold claim: Brooke won’t attend Hulk’s funeral; family rift resurfaces
content: In a shocking turn, Linda Hogan posted a video alleging Brooke Hogan wouldn't attend Hulk Hogan's funeral, citing past trauma and family issues. The wrestling world mourns Hulk Hogan, who passed away on July 24, 2025, from cardiac arrest. However, the video featuring Brooke was later revealed as an AI-generated fake, sparking further controversy.

title: Tamura obtained rifle in Vegas: Assembly allegedly aided by casino boss
content: A tragic shooting occurred in New York City at 345 Park Avenue, where Shane Tamura fatally shot four people before taking his own life. Tamura, who acquired an M4 assault-style rifle for $1400, left a note blaming CTE and the NFL for his actions.

title: Josh Hines‑Allen’s son Wesley in remission; family launches cancer support campaign
content: Jacksonville Jaguars star Josh Hines-Allen's son, Wesley, was diagnosed with acute promyelocytic leukemia in January 2025. Hines-Allen missed a game due to the crisis. Wesley underwent chemotherapy for months at Nemours Children’s Health in Jacksonville. The family launched “Four One For Hope” to support childhood cancer nonprofits. Wesley is now recovering, back to playing and attending school.

title: J&K infiltration bid foiled: 2 terrorists killed near LoC; hand grenades, IEDs seized
content: In a joint operation based on intelligence inputs, Indian soldiers neutralized two terrorists near the LoC in Poonch district, Jammu & Kashmir. The gunfight erupted after troops detected suspicious movement in a forested area. Authorities recovered assault rifles, a pistol, ammunition, grenades, IEDs, and communication devices.

title: Gilbert Arenas arrested: Feds allege illegal poker ring
content: Former NBA star Gilbert Arenas faces federal charges for allegedly running an illegal high-stakes poker operation at his Encino residence. Prosecutors claim Arenas, known as "Agent Zero," conspired with five others, including Yevgeni Gershman, to host the games between September 2021 and July 2022. Gershman allegedly employed women to serve players.

title: 'Bharat mata ki jai': India stand firm, refuse to face Pakistan in WCL semifinal
content: The Yuvraj Singh-led India Champions have refused to play Pakistan in the World Championship of Legends semifinals, mirroring their earlier group-stage boycott. This decision, supported by legends like Shikhar Dhawan and Harbhajan Singh, stems from the Pahalgam terror attack. An insider emphasised the team's unwavering commitment to the nation, echoing Dhawan's sentiment that the country comes first.

title: Travis Kelce planned his Taylor Swift photo dump with her approval
content: Travis Kelce's Instagram post with Taylor Swift created buzz. Sources say Kelce wanted to show their relationship is serious. Swift approved all photos. Fans decoded hidden meanings, like the lock screen photo. The timing was deliberate, during their break. Insiders suggest this is a step towards being more public. The couple is happy and ready to share more with fans.

title: Sudden Braking On Highway Is Negligence: Supreme Court
content: In a significant verdict, the Supreme Court has held that a car driver, who applies sudden brakes on a highway without any warning, can be held negligent in the event of a road accident.

title: Tariffs On India, Trade With Pakistan: Rewinding Latest Round Of Trump Deals
content: US President Donald Trump has announced 25 per cent tariffs on imports from India plus a "penalty", while his administration struck a deal with Pakistan in which Washington will work with Islamabad in developing the South Asian nation's oil reserves.

title: 6 Indian Companies Sanctioned By US Over Iran Petroleum Purchases
content: The US Department of State Wednesday announced sanctions on 20 entities, including six from India, for trading with Iran.

title: Indian National Gets 14 Years In Jail For Sexually Assaulting Girl In Singapore
content: An Indian national was sentenced to over 14 years in jail in Singapore on Thursday for sexually assaulting an 11-year-old girl twice.

title: Tamil Actor S Srinivasan Arrested In High-Value Loan Fraud Case
content: Tamil film actor and self-styled doctor S Srinivasan also known as 'Powerstar' was arrested by the Economic Offences Wing in the national capital in a high-value loan fraud case, according to officials.

title: Telangana Firm Accused Of Rs 100 Crore Tax Evasion Using Fake Bills
content: The Commercial Taxes Department of Telangana has uncovered a significant Goods and Services Tax (GST) fraud amounting to over Rs 100 crore allegedly orchestrated by Hyderabad-based M/s Keshaan Industries LLP.

title: Delhi Civic Body Lays Out Plan To Address Stray Dog Menace
content: On Wednesday, the Delhi civic body chaired a meeting to address stray dog attacks in the capital, forming a Standing Committee to address the menace.

title: Russia's 'Land Of Fire And Ice' Was Largely Spared By Earthquake, Tsunami
content: A powerful earthquake struck Wednesday off Russia's Far East coast, flooding a fishing port with waves from a tsunami, cutting power to a few areas and sending some panicked residents fleeing buildings but causing only a few injuries.

title: 'Why Is Trump Troubling India?': Leaders React To US' 25% Tariff Strike
content: The Congress party slammed the BJP government as US President Donald Trump slapped India with 25 per cent tariffs on Wednesday. In a post on X, the Congress party wrote, "country is now bearing the cost of Narendra Modi's 'friendship'".

title: Malegaon Blast Case Verdict Today, 17 Years After The Deadly Explosion
content: Seventeen years after a powerful blast hit Malegaon in Maharashtra, a special NIA court in Mumbai will pronounce its verdict in the 2008 Malegaon bomb blast case today.

title: Russia Earthquake, Tsunami Highlights: Chile Upgraded Tsunami Warning To The Highest Level After Earthquake
content: Russia Earthquake, Tsunami Highlights: An earthquake of magnitude 8.8 - one of the world's strongest-struck Russia's Far Eastern Kamchatka Peninsula early on Wednesday, generating a tsunami of up to 4 metres (13 feet).

title: Delhi Man Jumps Into Yamuna After Fight With Wife, Rescued By Boatmen: Cops
content: A 30-year-old man jumped into the Yamuna to kill himself after a fight with his wife, but was rescued by two boatmen, police said on Wednesday.

title: 1 Kanwar Pilgrim Dead, 3 Injured As Truck Runs Over Them In Madhya Pradesh
content: 25-year-old Kanwar pilgrim was killed and six others were injured when a speeding truck hit them in Madhya Pradesh's Indore district on Wednesday night, a police officer said.

title: Millions Return Home As Pacific Tsunami Warnings Lifted
content: Tsunami warnings were lifted across the Pacific rim Wednesday, allowing millions of temporary evacuees to return home.

title: "We're Negotiating With India Right Now": Trump After Imposing 25% Tariff
content: President Donald Trump on Wednesday referred to the BRICS grouping and the "tremendous" trade deficit with New Delhi for announcing the 25 per cent tariff and said the US is currently negotiating with India.

title: Kamala Harris Says She Won't Run For Governor Of California In 2026
content: Democratic former U.S. Vice President Kamala Harris said on Wednesday she will not run for governor of California, ending speculation that the failed presidential candidate would seek the high-profile post.

title: "Maybe They'll Sell To India": Trump Announces "Massive" Oil Partnership With Pak
content: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Wednesday his administration struck a deal with Pakistan in which Washington will work with Islamabad in developing the South Asian nation's oil reserves.

title: Canada Plans To Recognise Palestinian State In September
content: Canada plans to recognize a Palestinian state at the UN General Assembly in September, Prime Minister Mark Carney said Wednesday, a dramatic policy shift he said was necessary to preserve hopes of a two-state solution.

title: Over 40 Palestinians Killed While Waiting For Food At Gaza Crossing
content: Israeli strikes and gunfire in the Gaza Strip killed at least 46 Palestinians overnight and into Wednesday, most of them among crowds seeking food, health officials said.

title: Ganja Worth Rs 40 Crore Seized At Hyderabad Airport, Woman Arrested
content: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) on Wednesday recovered 400 kg of hydroponic ganja from the luggage of a woman passenger at the Rajiv Gandhi International Airport here, an official release said.

title: Inclusion of TRF in report under 1267 Committee a boost for India’s counter-terror campaign: officials
content: India has described the TRF as a front of the Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) and accused it of carrying out the Pahalgam terror attack; in its report, the Monitoring Team of the panel noted that the TRF had taken responsibility for the attack

title: Andhra Pradesh to focus on expanding tourism infrastructure
content: Promoting key cities like Visakhapatnam, Vijayawada, and Tirupati as preferred MICE destinations, unlocking the potential of tier-2 and tier-3 locations and advancing PPP models to drive sustainable and inclusive regional growth are priorities, says APTDC Managing Director

title: BJP MP raises demand in Lok Sabha for Bharat Ratna to Dalai Lama
content: “Today, the Dalai Lama is not just a religious figure but also a symbol of peace across the world. His teachings have shaped generations and he deserves the Bharat Ratna,” BJP MP Tapir Gao said

title: Opposition targets India’s diplomacy over Trump’s tariff announcement, seeks explanation from PM
content: ‘Trump is targeting India politically, economically, and morally. And the Prime Minister is not being truthful, neither to the people nor to Parliament,’ CPI general secretary D. Raja said

title: Constable did not get NOC to marry Pakistani woman, CRPF tells J&K HC
content: Constable challenges dismissal in the wake of the Pahalgam attack, saying service rules only required him to inform authorities; CRPF says rules were framed 60 years ago, when Pakistan was not a hostile nation

title: No local has joined terror groups in J&K in the last six months, says Amit Shah
content: Those being killed in security operations in the Union Territory are all foreigners, Home Minister tells Rajya Sabha

title: General Dwivedi reviews security situation in Manipur
content: General Upendra Dwivedi also called on the Governor of Manipur Ajay Kumar Bhalla and discussed matters on security and development

title: No bail for jailed nuns as Chhattisgarh court cites jurisdiction issues
content: Nuns told to move a special court for relief; their bail application said the girls accompanying them had volunteered for nursing training and work, and that charges of conversion are baseless

title: NMC grants conditional renewal, recognition to 22 government medical colleges in Karnataka
content: The colleges have been given four months to comply, but no penalty has been imposed on any of them this year

title: Air India Group tops audit with 19 critical safety breaches; DGCA says ‘entirely normal’
content: With 300 aircraft, Air India also had 74 level 2 findings, while IndiGo with 419 aircraft had 23; DGCA says high number of findings don’t reflect unusual lapse but scale of airline operations

title: Former YSRCP government didn’t pay Andhra Pradesh’s share of crop insurance, says Union Agriculture Minister Chouhan
content: Centre’s crop insurance scheme had to be revamped as some States didn’t cooperate with it, says Chouhan

title: Blocked 1,400 ‘anti-India’ URLs during Operation Sindoor, says Governement
content: The Information & Broadcasting Minister said, “the government found that massive fake news, misinformation and propaganda campaigns were being run, mostly from outside India”

title: Day 2 of search for skeletal remains yields no results in Dharmasthala
content: Sources in the SIT said they will continue digging at the other spots shown by the complainant on July 20

title: Opposition walks out of Rajya Sabha over Modi’s absence during conclusion of debate on Operation Sindoor
content: Several leaders flag U.S. President Donald Trump’s repeated claims on brokering a ceasefire between India and Pakistan

title: Badri Narayan Tiwari appointed Vice-Chancellor of TISS
content: Professor Tiwari, former head of the Govind Ballabh Pant Social Science Institute in Prayagraj, is the first V-C to be appointed by the Ministry of Education under its new regulations

title: Base kitchen serving trains closed down, slapped with fine of ₹1 lakh
content: Large quantities of stale food were seized in May this year from the facility at Kadavanthra in Kochi

title: India, UAE agree to elevate defence ties
content: At a meeting in New Delhi, the two sides agreed to enhance military training cooperation and discussed their respective training requirements

title: No country can ‘direct’ another’s trade rules: RSS’s economic wing on U.S. trade tariff
content: India did not recognise any sanctions from any country, except the ones issued by the United Nations, it said

title: Supreme Court asks Tamil Nadu government to explain its prosecutorial plan for cases involving Senthilbalaji
content: The Supreme Court said that the alleged bribe-givers in the case were actually victims, turning them into the accused would delay the trial

title: Britain's airspace shut: All outbound UK flights grounded by 'technical issue'
content: A technical issue at the UK's National Air Traffic Services (Nats) caused airspace closure across the country on Wednesday evening. Engineers have successfully restored the affected system, and normal operations are resuming in the London area. Nats is collaborating with airlines and airports to minimize disruption and apologizes for the inconvenience.

title: Railways to get 17,000 non-AC coaches in next five years, says Vaishnaw
content: Due to higher availability of general coaches, the number of passengers traveling in general and unreserved coaches has increased, the Minister said in a reply in Lok Sabha

title: Tirupati in grip of fear as elephant herd and leopard roam near Tirumala foothills
content: Forest officials urge devotees to move in groups and stay alert; Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan directs intensified patrolling in forest fringe villages

title: MLB trade deadline updates, rumors: Countdown to biggest deals is on
content: Which contenders will make the biggest splash? Here's what we're hearing as 6 p.m. ET on Thursday approaches.

title: Ohtani's start cut short in 4th due to cramping
content: Dodgers star Shohei Ohtani threw six straight balls in the fourth inning and left the mound after dealing with cramping in his right hip during Wednesday night's start against the Reds.

title: Phillies get their closer by landing Twins' Duran
content: The Phillies acquired star closer Jhoan Duran from the Twins, who get right-hander Mick Abel and catcher Eduardo Tait, both prospects, in return.

title: Raiders agree to 3-year extension with LT Miller
content: The Las Vegas Raiders reached a contract extension with starting left tackle Kolton Miller on Wednesday, with sources telling ESPN's Jeremy Fowler that the deal is for three years and $66 million, with $42.5M guaranteed.

title: Mets keep fortifying bullpen, get Cards' Helsley
content: The Mets traded three players to the Cardinals for closer Ryan Helsley, who was expected to serve as the setup man in New York for Edwin Diaz.

title: Police: Vegas casino supervisor sold gunman rifle
content: A man who killed four people at a Manhattan office building bought the rifle he used in the attack and the car he drove across the country from his supervisor at a Las Vegas casino, authorities said Wednesday.

title: Messi returns for Miami win: 'I need to compete'
content: Lionel Messi said he struggled to find rhythm in the first half against Atlas on Wednesday night at Chase Stadium before setting up two second-half goals -- including a late winner -- in a 2-1 victory to kick off Inter Miami CF's Leagues Cup campaign.

title: Arenas arrested on illegal poker game charges
content: Gilbert Arenas was arrested in connection with a federal indictment that alleges the former NBA star hosted illegal high-stakes poker games at his mansion.

title: The real most valuable players on every NFL team: Who would return multiple first-round picks via trade?
content: This exhaustive NFL trade guide factors in ability, positional value, contracts and age to figure out which players are really worth a first-round pick.

title: Five trades that make too much sense: Which teams should make a deal now?
content: As teams look to finalize their rosters, Seth Walder proposes trades that could help all sides involved.

title: How Chris Bey's life changed after one routine move went catastrophically wrong
content: After a life-changing spinal cord injury, Chris Bey wasn't expected to walk again. Nine months later, he's not only walking, he is eyeing a return to professional wrestling.
